identificationModule.briefTitle: In Silico Study Assessing the Impact of Inclisiran on Major Adverse Cardiovascular Events in Patients With Established Cardiovascular Disease
identificationModule.officialTitle: In Silico Non Interventional Secondary Use of Data Study Assessing the Impact of Inclisiran on Major Adverse Cardiovascular Events in Patients With Established Cardiovascular Disease

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Study CKJX839B1FR01 in an In silico trial to predict the efficacy of Inclisiran therapy on major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) and cardiovascular (CV) death in virtual patients with atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) and elevated LDL-C.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Purpose of this study is to predict the size of efficacy of inclisiran 300 mg s.c., administered on Day 1, Month 3 (Day 90), and every 6 months thereafter in addition to currently available lipid lowering therapies (LLTs) on a 3-Point-Major Adverse Cardiovascular Events (3P-MACE) defined as a composite of CV death, non-fatal myocardial infarction (MI) or non-fatal ischemic stroke, and on CV death, in a secondary prevention cohort of ASCVD virtual patients with a LDL-C ≥ 70 mg/dL. This will be compared to 1) placebo in adjunct to high-intensity statin therapy with or without ezetimibe, 2) ezetimibe in adjunct to high-intensity statin therapy, 3) Evolocumab in adjunct to high-intensity statin therapy and ezetimibe.

armGroups.label: Virtual Patient with ASCVD
armGroups.description: Virtual Patient with ASCVD and LDL-C ≥ 70 mg/dL despite receiving a well-tolerated high-intensity statin with or without ezetimibe. Each virtual patient is his own control.

interventions.name: Inclisiran sodium
interventions.description: Drug: Inclisiran sodium 300 mg virtually subcutaneously administered on Day 1, Month 3 (Day 90) and every 6 months thereafter until end of simulation.

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: Drug: Placebo virtually subcutaneously administered on Day 1, Month 3 (Day 90) and every 6 months thereafter until end of simulation.

interventions.name: Ezetimibe
interventions.description: Drug: Ezetimibe 10 mg virtually orally once a day until end of simulation.

interventions.name: Evolocumab
interventions.description: Drug: Evolocumab 140 mg virtually subcutaneously administered every two weeks until end of simulation.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Time to the first occurrence between trial start and end of follow-up of any component of 3P-MACE (composite of CV death, non-fatal MI or non-fatal ischemic stroke)
primaryOutcomes.description: 3P-MACE is a confirmed composite endpoint which includes cardiovascular death, non-fatal myocardial infarction and non-fatal ischemic stroke.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Time to the first occurrence between trial start and end of follow-up of CV death
primaryOutcomes.description: CV death is defined as death due to cardiovascular events

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to the first occurrence between trial start and end of follow-up of MI (non-fatal or fatal)
Time to the first occurrence between trial start and end of follow-up of ischemic stroke (non-fatal or fatal)
Time to the first occurrence between trial start and end of follow-up of Major Adverse Limb events (MALE)
secondaryOutcomes.description: MALE include acute lower limb ischemia, lower limb amputation due to ischemia, or urgent lower limb revascularization for ischemia

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in LDL-C from baseline to specified time points
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, day 1, 30, 90 and every 6 months afterwards will be presented and additional time points could be added if deemed necessary.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time adjusted percentage change in LDL-C
secondaryOutcomes.description: This is the average percentage change in LDL-C from baseline over period from Day 90 and the end of follow-up period.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From baseline between Day 90 and the end of follow-up period (up to 5 years)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria :

1. Patients with atherosclerotic CV disease, defined as any of the following

   i. Previous MI

   ii. Previous ischemic stroke

   iii. Previous symptomatic peripheral arterial disease (PAD) as evidenced by either intermittent claudication with ABI \<0.85, prior peripheral arterial revascularization procedure, or amputation due to atherosclerotic disease
2. Fasting LDL-C ≥ 70 mg/dL
3. Under stable (≥ 4 weeks) well-tolerated high-intensity statin with or without ezetimibe.

Exclusion Criteria :

Patients with acute coronary syndrome, ischemic stroke, peripheral arterial revascularization procedure or amputation due to atherosclerotic disease \<4 weeks prior to the first study visit
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Virtual Patient with ASCVD (previous MI, previous ischemic stroke, previous peripheral arterial disease) and LDL-C ≥ 70 mg/dL despite receiving a well-tolerated high-intensity statin with or without ezetimibe.
